messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Farming (Shelley)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/7/2003 11:24:10 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... Elissa Jill, I m the one in West Virginia.  We live outside of Buckhannon, about an hour
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/7/2003 11:24:10 AM Eastern Standard Time,
Earthmomma67@... writes:

> Where in West Virginia are you? I'm building a home in the Eastern
> Panhandle.
> *~*Elissa Jill*~*
>
Elissa Jill, I'm the one in West Virginia. We live outside of Buckhannon,
about an hour from Clarksburg and 1/2 hour from Elkins...I guess you'd call it
north central WV.

What type of house are you building? We built ours of rough cut lumber and
anything else we could scrounge up...free windows, free bathtub, 5.00
sinks,...built the whole thing for under about 9,000, not counting well and septic.
Our roof is out of oak, (with shingles over the top of course), the frame is
poplar, and the sides are cherry. It's very nice living in timber country...it's
dirt cheap here!

Nancy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Farming (Shelley)
messages.msgSnippet: ... Oops!  I meant to say with as MUCH snow.  I know that WV still gets it s share of snowfall. --Shelley, Mommy to Jacob (2 1/2 yrs) and Gabriel (4 mos) ...
messages.messageBody:
>I'm in CT not WV -- lucky you, tho, you don't have to deal with snow! :-)

Oops! I meant to say with as MUCH snow. I know that WV still gets it's share of snowfall.

--Shelley, Mommy to Jacob (2 1/2 yrs) and Gabriel (4 mos)
